name: MacGuffin's Curse
description: Sneak and smash your way through this fiendishly addictive comedy-puzzle-adventure
minimum_requirements: OS:Windows XP Memory:256 MB RAM Graphics:256MB VRAM DirectX®:9.0c Hard Drive:350 MB HD space
recommended_requirements: OS:Windows 7 Memory:500 MB RAM Graphics:512MB VRAM DirectX®:9.0c Hard Drive:415 MB HD space

reviews.review_text: Lots of fun, if you like block puzzling games. By the end there are a handful of puzzles that just feel tedious due to the iterative repetition to complete, but on the whole it is a very enjoyable experience. 5/5

A game from the creators of Jolly Rover, (which I would also recommend) you play as Lucas a magician turned thief who becomes a werewolf after stealing a cursed necklace. The game is a puzzle adventure and Lucas has the ability to switch between human and wolf forms which becomes necessary for solving puzzles since each form has abilities that the other lacks. The game is fun, the puzzles are challenging and the game is quite humorous. Plus you're a werewolf who solves puzzles! How cool is that?!
fun little puzzle game. Has a wolf in it, Feel bad that i had to check one or two solutions.
The puzzles are challenging, the characters are engaging, and the dialogue is hilarious. Play this game.
A very casual and pleasurable experience. This baby has no timers, no limited resources, and no other crap you may expect. Buy it if you like puzzle games that don't punish you for everything.
Fun and simple puzzle game. The ability to read develpoer's comments upon backtracking is a really nice touch as well.

It's a passable block-sliding game, with passable writing and a no-foul puzzle-skip function. Unfortunately it also hangs at the drop of a hat when something steals focus or you switch tasks, so I really can't recommend it.
